Label: DC-coupled sensor potentials and negative of spacecraft potential relative to sensor floating potentials from RBSP-EFW. - J. R. Wygant (University of Minnesota)

DatasetLink.Title: Daily Summary Plots and additional L2 data
DatasetLink.Text: EFW home page at Minnesota with

DatasetLink.Title: Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)

VariableDescription.Name: vsvy
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         rbsp
#     SOURCE_NAME                     RBSPA>Radiation Belt Storm Probe A
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DESCRIPTOR                      EFW-L2>Electric Field and Waves Level 2
#     DATA_TYPE                       VxVy-HiRes>Sensor Potentials and SC Potential
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_descriptor_datatype
#     DATA_VERSION                    01
#     PI_NAME                         J. R. Wygant
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Minnesota
#     TEXT                            CDAWeb interface derived data on Fri Jun 14 15:33:16 EDT 2013. Contacts:  Tami.J.Kovalick@nasa.gov,    
#     TEXT                             Rita.C.Johnson@nasa.gov. DC-coupled EFW sensor potentials relative to spacecraft                      
#     TEXT                             in volts. All six EFW sensor potentials are included. The quantities (V1+V2)/2,                       
#     TEXT                             (V3+V4)/2, and (V5+V6)/2 are also included.  These quantities are the negative                        
#     TEXT                             of the spacecraft potential relative to the sensor floating potential, and                            
#     TEXT                             remove the contribution from the external electric field. The default sampling                        
#     TEXT                             rate is 16 samp/s at 16-bit resolution, covering a +/- 225-V range.  Further                          
#     TEXT                             details on the EFW instrument in general or these data in particular can be                           
#     TEXT                             found in the EFW Instrument paper, Wygant et al., 2013 (Space Science Reviews;                        
#                                      submitted, 02/2013).                                                                                  
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Van Allen Probes (RBSP)
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      DC-coupled sensor potentials and negative of spacecraft potential relative to                          
#                                      sensor floating potentials from RBSP-EFW.                                                             
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 UTC
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Open Data for Scientific Use; please see EFW "Rules of the Road" (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/data_policy
#     RULES_OF_USE                     for details of the Van Allen Probes Mission and EFW Instrument "Rules of the                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     Road", and the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for details                           
#                                      of and caveats on instrument performance and data quality.                                            
#     GENERATED_BY                    RBSP-EFW SOC
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 This work was supported by Van Allen Probes (RBSP) EFW funding provided by JHU/APL                     
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                  Contract No. TBD under NASA's Prime Contract No. TBD; EFW PI, J. R. Wygant,                           
#                                      UMN.                                                                                                  
#     MODS                            v01:  initial version; started with L1 EFW VSVY CDF, removing all L0 (e.g. CCSDS                       
#     MODS                             packet header) variables, changing variable type of VSVY variable from INT                            
#     MODS                             to REAL to reflect tranformation from TM to Physical units; added variables                           
#     MODS                             for average of opposing sensors, VSVY_AVG; added variable for sensor potential                        
#                                      quality flag, VSVY_QUAL. Added EFW data quality flag array.                                           
#     ADID_REF                        n/a
#     LINK_TEXT                       EFW home page at Minnesota with
#                                     Van Allen Probes
#     LINK_TITLE                      Daily Summary Plots and additional L2 data
#                                     Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://rbsp.space.umn.edu
#                                     http://rbspgway.jhuapl.edu/
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Fiducial UTC YYYY:MM:DDTHH:MM:SS
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires_00000000_v01
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, UTC
#       NOTES:  Time tags for the survey quantities
#  2. EFW Sensor Voltages, V1..V6.
#       NOTES:  EFW Sensor voltages relative to spacecraft ground.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:27:40 2015

#     TEXT                             (V3+V4)/2, and (V5+V6)/2 are also included.  These quantities are the negative

#     MODS                            v01:  initial version; started with L1 EFW VSVY CDF, removing all L0 (e.g. CCSDS                       
#     MODS                             packet header) variables, changing variable type of VSVY variable from INT                            
#     MODS                             to REAL to reflect tranformation from TM to Physical units; added variables                           
#     MODS                             for average of opposing sensors, VSVY_AVG; added variable for sensor potential                        
#                                      quality flag, VSVY_QUAL. Added EFW data quality flag array.

#                                     Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://rbsp.space.umn.edu
#                                     http://rbspgway.jhuapl.edu/
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Fiducial UTC YYYY:MM:DDTHH:MM:SS
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires_00000000_v01
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, UTC
#       NOTES:  Time tags for the survey quantities
#  2. Average potential from opposing booms (autoscale)

# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.

VariableDescription.Name: vsvy_BEB_config
VariableDescription.LongDescription: EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB) configuration code (sensor biases)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         rbsp
#     SOURCE_NAME                     RBSPA>Radiation Belt Storm Probe A

#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_descriptor_datatype

#     TEXT                            CDAWeb interface derived data on Fri Jun 14 15:33:16 EDT 2013. Contacts:  Tami.J.Kovalick@nasa.gov,    
#     TEXT                             Rita.C.Johnson@nasa.gov. DC-coupled EFW sensor potentials relative to spacecraft                      
#     TEXT                             in volts. All six EFW sensor potentials are included. The quantities (V1+V2)/2,                       
#     TEXT                             (V3+V4)/2, and (V5+V6)/2 are also included.  These quantities are the negative                        
#     TEXT                             of the spacecraft potential relative to the sensor floating potential, and                            
#     TEXT                             remove the contribution from the external electric field. The default sampling                        
#     TEXT                             rate is 16 samp/s at 16-bit resolution, covering a +/- 225-V range.  Further                          
#     TEXT                             details on the EFW instrument in general or these data in particular can be                           
#     TEXT                             found in the EFW Instrument paper, Wygant et al., 2013 (Space Science Reviews;                        
#                                      submitted, 02/2013).                                                                                  
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Van Allen Probes (RBSP)
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      DC-coupled sensor potentials and negative of spacecraft potential relative to                          
#                                      sensor floating potentials from RBSP-EFW.                                                             
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 UTC
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Open Data for Scientific Use; please see EFW "Rules of the Road" (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/data_policy
#     RULES_OF_USE                     for details of the Van Allen Probes Mission and EFW Instrument "Rules of the                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     Road", and the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for details                           
#                                      of and caveats on instrument performance and data quality.

#                                      UMN.

#     MODS                             packet header) variables, changing variable type of VSVY variable from INT                            
#     MODS                             to REAL to reflect tranformation from TM to Physical units; added variables                           
#     MODS                             for average of opposing sensors, VSVY_AVG; added variable for sensor potential                        
#                                      quality flag, VSVY_QUAL. Added EFW data quality flag array.

#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Configuration (HSK) timetags, UTC.
#       NOTES:  Configuration timetags. Used for BEB and DFB config values..
#  2. EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB) configuration code (sensor biases)
#       NOTES:  Indicates the configuration of the EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB).  Encodes the following information:  for each sensor, sensor current bias, usher and guard voltage bias.  See TBD_URL for details of mapping between code value and instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation).

#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:27:43 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Indicates the configuration of the EFW Boom Electronics Board (BEB).  Encodes the following information:  for each sensor, sensor current bias, usher and guard voltage bias.  See TBD_URL for details of mapping between code value and instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation).
#
CONFIGURATION_(HSK)_TIMETAGS,_UTC   VSVY_BEB_CONFIG
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic                
05-09-2012 14:36:00.733.307.000.000               0

VariableDescription.Name: vsvy_DFB_config
VariableDescription.LongDescription: ---> EFW Digital Fields Board (DFB) configuration code (on-board spectral and waveform processing configuration)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         rbsp
#     SOURCE_NAME                     RBSPA>Radiation Belt Storm Probe A
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science

#     DATA_TYPE                       VxVy-HiRes>Sensor Potentials and SC Potential
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_descriptor_datatype

#     PI_NAME                         J. R. Wygant
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Minnesota
#     TEXT                            CDAWeb interface derived data on Fri Jun 14 15:33:16 EDT 2013. Contacts:  Tami.J.Kovalick@nasa.gov,    
#     TEXT                             Rita.C.Johnson@nasa.gov. DC-coupled EFW sensor potentials relative to spacecraft                      
#     TEXT                             in volts. All six EFW sensor potentials are included. The quantities (V1+V2)/2,                       
#     TEXT                             (V3+V4)/2, and (V5+V6)/2 are also included.  These quantities are the negative                        
#     TEXT                             of the spacecraft potential relative to the sensor floating potential, and                            
#     TEXT                             remove the contribution from the external electric field. The default sampling                        
#     TEXT                             rate is 16 samp/s at 16-bit resolution, covering a +/- 225-V range.  Further                          
#     TEXT                             details on the EFW instrument in general or these data in particular can be                           
#     TEXT                             found in the EFW Instrument paper, Wygant et al., 2013 (Space Science Reviews;                        
#                                      submitted, 02/2013).                                                                                  
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Van Allen Probes (RBSP)
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      DC-coupled sensor potentials and negative of spacecraft potential relative to                          
#                                      sensor floating potentials from RBSP-EFW.                                                             
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 UTC
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Open Data for Scientific Use; please see EFW "Rules of the Road" (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/data_policy
#     RULES_OF_USE                     for details of the Van Allen Probes Mission and EFW Instrument "Rules of the                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     Road", and the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for details                           
#                                      of and caveats on instrument performance and data quality.                                            
#     GENERATED_BY                    RBSP-EFW SOC
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 This work was supported by Van Allen Probes (RBSP) EFW funding provided by JHU/APL                     
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                  Contract No. TBD under NASA's Prime Contract No. TBD; EFW PI, J. R. Wygant,                           
#                                      UMN.                                                                                                  
#     MODS                            v01:  initial version; started with L1 EFW VSVY CDF, removing all L0 (e.g. CCSDS                       
#     MODS                             packet header) variables, changing variable type of VSVY variable from INT                            
#     MODS                             to REAL to reflect tranformation from TM to Physical units; added variables                           
#     MODS                             for average of opposing sensors, VSVY_AVG; added variable for sensor potential                        
#                                      quality flag, VSVY_QUAL. Added EFW data quality flag array.                                           
#     ADID_REF                        n/a
#     LINK_TEXT                       EFW home page at Minnesota with
#                                     Van Allen Probes
#     LINK_TITLE                      Daily Summary Plots and additional L2 data
#                                     Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://rbsp.space.umn.edu
#                                     http://rbspgway.jhuapl.edu/
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Fiducial UTC YYYY:MM:DDTHH:MM:SS
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 rbspa_efw-l2_vsvy-hires_00000000_v01
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Configuration (HSK) timetags, UTC.
#       NOTES:  Configuration timetags. Used for BEB and DFB config values..
#  2. ---> EFW Digital Fields Board (DFB) configuration code (on-board spectral and waveform processing configuration)
#       NOTES:  Indicates the configuration of the EFW Digital Filter Board (DFB).  Encodes the following information:  assignment of analog input channels to the various on-board spectral processors (FBK, SPEC, XSPEC); parameters of the on-board B-field-aligned data processing; nominal or contingency multiplexer programming.  See TBD URL for detailed mapping from code value to instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation).
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:27:43 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Indicates the configuration of the EFW Digital Filter Board (DFB).  Encodes the following information:  assignment of analog input channels to the various on-board spectral processors (FBK, SPEC, XSPEC); parameters of the on-board B-field-aligned data processing; nominal or contingency multiplexer programming.  See TBD URL for detailed mapping from code value to instrument configuration (not crucial for L2 data interpretation).
#
CONFIGURATION_(HSK)_TIMETAGS,_UTC   VSVY_DFB_CONFIG
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic                
05-09-2012 14:36:00.733.307.000.000               0
